evals.prompt: Turn this into a skill: Every morning, check the git log for the last 24 hours, summarize what changed, and post it to a markdown file called daily-digest.md
evals.expected_output: A skill directory created at ~/.claude/skills/daily-digest/ with a SKILL.md that has a pushy description mentioning 8+ trigger phrases, and a command file at ~/.claude/commands/daily-digest.md
expectations: SKILL.md exists at ~/.claude/skills/daily-digest/SKILL.md
Command file exists at ~/.claude/commands/daily-digest.md
SKILL.md description contains 8+ trigger phrases
SKILL.md body includes instructions for git log, summarize, and write to markdown
SKILL.md is under 500 lines
Command file is under 10 lines
Confirmation message lists the trigger phrases and how to test

evals.prompt: I keep pasting this prompt every session: 'Read the project's package.json, check all dependencies for known vulnerabilities using npm audit, and give me a prioritized list of what to update with breaking change warnings.' Can you make it permanent?
evals.expected_output: Skill installed as dep-audit or similar, with /command, recognizing 'make it permanent' as a trigger for this skill
expectations: Skill name is concise and kebab-case (e.g., dep-audit, dependency-check)
The skill triggers on phrases like 'check dependencies', 'npm audit', 'vulnerability scan', 'security check'
SKILL.md body preserves the core workflow: read package.json → npm audit → prioritize → warn about breaking changes
Command file supports being run without arguments
Installed globally (not project-level)

evals.prompt: Skillify this workflow: I give you a React component, you analyze its accessibility, check ARIA labels, test keyboard navigation patterns, suggest fixes, and output a before/after diff
evals.expected_output: Skill installed with accessibility-focused trigger phrases, including edge cases like 'a11y' and 'screen reader'
expectations: Skill name relates to accessibility (e.g., a11y-audit, react-a11y)
Description includes 'a11y', 'accessibility', 'ARIA', 'screen reader', 'keyboard navigation' as triggers
Description includes edge case: 'even if they just say check this component'
SKILL.md body covers: ARIA analysis, keyboard nav patterns, fix suggestions, diff output
Has at least 2 examples in the body

evals.prompt: Make a /command called 'standup' that generates a standup summary from my git commits and open PRs for today
evals.expected_output: Skill and command created with the exact name 'standup' as requested, not a generated name
expectations: Skill name is exactly 'standup' (user specified it)
Command file is at ~/.claude/commands/standup.md
SKILL.md triggers on 'standup', 'daily standup', 'what did I do today', 'standup summary'
Body includes: git log for today's commits, check open PRs, format as standup update
Command file includes $ARGUMENTS for optional date override

evals.prompt: I want to reuse this but it's kind of vague: make something that helps me write better emails
evals.expected_output: The skill flags this as too broad and asks for clarification, or narrows it down to a specific workflow before building
expectations: Skill either asks a clarifying question (max 2) OR narrows the scope itself
Does NOT create a vague, overly broad skill
If built, the skill focuses on a specific email type or workflow rather than 'all emails'
Demonstrates the 'Too broad' error handling from the skill instructions
